result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joel F Martinez

records.addlTxt:
3:28 PM Defendant Joel F Martinez in court.  Attorney Ricardo Tapia in court for Joel F Martinez.  Prosecuting attorney Randy P. Sitzberger in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
All parties are ready to proceed with Motion to Suppress filed on 8/17/22.  
State calls Officer Lincoln who is sworn in and testifies. 
Atty Tapia cross examines the witness. 
Atty Sitzberger asks a few follow up questions. 
Atty Tapia asks questions on redirect. 

State gives closing statements. 
Atty Tapia makes closing statements. 

The court denies the motion to suppress for reasons stated on the record.
Hearing scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on December 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Motion hearing on October 19, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

for Adjournment filed by the State

**Reviewed by Judge Bugenhagen Jr. on 08-18-2022: Take the status hearing off and schedule the motion hearing.**
Hearing on August 24, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

09:54 AM Defendant Joel F Martinez in court with attorney Ricardo Tapia.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

09:24 AM Defendant Joel F Martinez in court, in custody, with attorney Ricardo Tapia.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Tapia requests a bail modification and states reasons on the record. 
State objects to any bail modification and states reasons on the record. 
Atty Tapia makes a further statement to the court. 
Court modifies bond to a signature bond.

The Court orders the warrant remain in effect.
signed by Commissioner Costello on 5/23/2022
Code #2

08:44 AM Defendant Joel F Martinez not in court.  Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court finds two officers are here to testify.  Atty. Osborne requests costs $225.00 in addition to the May 11, 2022 costs due in 30 days.
Preliminary hearing on May 23, 2022 at 08:15 am.

02:54 PM Defendant Joel F Martinez in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant wishes to proceed without counsel.  State had two witnesses here yesterday for the preliminary hearing that was scheduled.  Defendant thought the court date was today.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Ext Code 2

10:30 AM Defendant Joel F Martinez not in court.  Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State motions the Court to issue a warrant for the defendant and to revoke and forfeit any bail.  Court issues a capias and revokes/forfeits bail.  State requests costs as they have two witnesses present today.   The Court orders repayment of costs for the appearance of the officer in Court today in the amount of $225.00.

**MINUTES UPDATED 05/17/2022:  Per Commissioner Rieck, witness fee due in 30 days.
Preliminary hearing on May 11, 2022 at 10:15 am.

10:40 AM Defendant Joel F Martinez in court.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court calls the matter for Status of Counsel and Prelim Hearing.
The Court goes over the procedural history of the case.
The Defendant presents statements as to his attorney situation and may want to represent himself and waive his prelim hearing.
The Court conducts a colloquy with the Defendant as to his right of an attorney and waiving or having a prelim.
The Defendant still wants to represent himself.

The Court recesses at 10:50 AM for the Defendant to fill out the Waiver of Right to Attrorney and Waiver of Prelim Form.
The Court recalls the matter at 11:35 AM with the same appearances.

The Defendant has filled out the Waiver of Right to Counsel form.
The Defendant presents statements. 
The Court will not do the waiver at this time and will adjourn the matter.
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
The Court puts that Defendant on notice that at the next hearing it will either be a waiver or hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 10:15 am.

10:13 AM Defendant Joel F Martinez in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.   Attorney appears as friend of the court. Jack A. Pitzo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court goes over the procedural history of the case.
Attorney Menden states the SPD needs to look into the case and to see if the Defendant is eligible for SPD representation and requests an adjournment.
No object from the State.
The Court will adjourn and tolls the time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 1, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

03:00 PM Defendant Joel F Martinez in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.   Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 1, 2022 at 09:15 am.
